title.narrative: Danish Church Aid efforts in Syria and Lebanon, 2016

description.narrative: Food security crises are averted for 575 targeted vulnerable displaced Syrians in Kobane, and for 2,500 Displaced Palestinian Refugees from Syria (DPRS) in Lebanon, for a period of 12 months. This project has two main components: Restoring and maintaining household food security and regular access to adequate and nutritious food, preserving household assets and supporting local markets in the city of Kobane (Ayn al-Arab), in northern Aleppo governorate, Syria through Cash-based assistance. Maintaining life-saving food security and psychosocial support for vulnerable DPRS in South Lebanon, with a special focus on vulnerable DPRS women and children to coping with the effects of displacement, trauma, abuse and marginalization in Lebanon. The specific objectives for the intervention are: Food security and living conditions for most vulnerable and internally displaced households in Kobane, Aleppo governorate in Syria are improved through the provision of cash in hard to reach and contested areas. Household food security is maintained for most vulnerable DPRS in Rashdieh, Buss and Burj el Shemali camps in Tyre and in Ein el Helweh camp in Saida, Southern Lebanon, for one year through the provision of food vouchers.
